fields.customfield_10312: The variables are available for the HTML to consume.
fields.description:
As backend HTML, I need the following variables to generate a full HTML template. For each ad-related item, I assume they are duplicated.

Please use the attached design or the following email design link as a reference to read the table below. _Some content elements in the email share the same variables, so you may see a few duplicated variables in the table with different explanations._ 

Email Design: zpl.io/boYxJwg 
  
|Gumtree ZA | | | |
|Variables |Explaination |Placeholder on current Design Template |Link UTM Appending Rule |
|${homepageLink}|homepage address for each country on the header |gumtree.co.za|?utm_medium=email&utm_source=system&utm_campaign=automated_recommendations&utm_content=header-homepage|
|${categoryL1Link}|L1 category on the header (e.g. Automotive Vehicles)|Cars for sale|?utm_medium=email&utm_source=system&utm_campaign=automated_recommendations&utm_content=categoryL1|
|${categoryL2Link}|L2 category on the header (e.g Cars & Bakkies)|Category 2|?utm_medium=email&utm_source=system&utm_campaign=automated_recommendations&utm_content=categoryL2|
|${firstName}|Use either user's first name or nickname |Henry |NA|
|${categoryL2}|Inside the body text, "We found these ads in [category]…"|[category]|NA|
|${ad.location}|L2 Location. Eg. Johannesburg |Sandton|NA|
